intro: Combretum attenuatum, commonly known as the slender combretum, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its slender, often branched stems. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats.
